The Elder Maṇipūjaka’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
who had gone beyond all things,
the Buddha who desired solitude,
went without faltering.
Not far from the Himalayas,
there was a great lake;
there was my dwelling,
connected with meritorious deeds.
Having come out from the dwelling,🔽I saw the Leader of the World;
like a blue lotus in bloom,
like a blazing fire.
I saw a flower being shaken,
and I thought: ‘They will worship the Leader’;
having gladdened my own mind,
I bowed down to the Teacher.
Taking a jewel from my head,
I worshipped the Leader of the World;
by this jewel worship,
may there be a good result.
Padumuttara, the knower of the world,
the receiver of offerings,

‘May your intention be fulfilled,
may you receive great happiness;
by this jewel worship,
experience great gain.’
After the Fortunate One said this,
The best of the water-born (lotuses),
The best of the Buddhas came,
To the place where my mind was fixed.
For sixty aeons the Lord of the Devas,
I was the King of the Devas;
And for many hundreds of times,
I was a King who rules by (the Dhamma of) the Wheel.
Remembering my past deeds,
while I was a god,
A jewel was produced for me,
which was a light to me.
Sixty-four thousand women,
were my possessions;
With various clothes and ornaments,

translated: with necklaces and earrings.🔽With slender waists and slender bodies,
with slender thighs and slender hips;
They always attended on me,
this is the fruit of worshipping with jewels.
Made of gold and made of jewels,
and also made of coral;
My treasures were well made,
whatever you desire to wear.🔽With upper rooms and inner rooms,
and a very expensive bed;
According to my thoughts,
whatever I desired was produced.
It is a gain for those, it is a great gain for those,
who obtain (the opportunity to) attend on him;
The field of merit for men,
the medicine for all living beings.

Day and night
there is always light for me.
Through that very worship of the jewel,
having experienced the perfection,
the light of knowledge was seen by me,
I have attained the unshakable state.
For a hundred thousand eons,
the jewel I worshipped,
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the jewel.
My defilements are destroyed,
I dwell without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical knowledges,
the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Maṇipūjaka recited these verses.
